Sushi comes in many forms.

Discover More

Not all nigiri is raw, though this dish is best for people who want to appreciate the flavor of the fish, shellfish, or other toppings!

Nigiri

A topping, usually fish, served on top of sushi rice. Nigiri is a more traditional form of sushi and can be a great way to try several kinds of fish.

This is best for people who really love to taste the fish or shellfish since it comes with nothing else!

Sashimi

Fish or shellfish served alone (no rice).

This is what most people think of when they think of sushi rolls! Maki rolls can contain just about anything, from your average raw fish such as salmon, yellow tail, or tuna, to veggies such carrots and cucumbers.

Maki

The combination rice and filling wrapped in seaweed makes for the most popular type of sushi.

These rolls often have lots of toppings and sauces â€” they may either be cooked or raw.

Uramaki

Similar to a Maki Roll, but the rice is on the outside and seaweed wraps around the filling. Uramaki is considered western-style sushi.

The cones are not as easy to share as the rolls (though very delicious!)

Temaki

Temaki is really cool. While standard rolls (maki and uramaki) are rolled with the help of a bamboo mat, temaki is rolled by hand. Because it"s rolled differently, temaki is coned shaped and larger than your average sushi roll.

Shrimp tempura rolls are probably the most popular tempura rolls out there, but some special rolls such as Tiger Rolls, Crunch Rolls, and Dragon Rolls.

Tempura Roll

Tempura rolls are basically deep fried maki or uramaki rolls. Tempura (method of deep frying fish or vegetable) is an example of the western love for deep-fried everything; even sushi.

Explore and experience the creative art of Sushi.
